1999 Asian  Judo Championship
    Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Korean women Judoists Kye Sun Hui and Cha Hyon Hyang won matches in the 52 kg and 48 kg divisions at the 1999 Asian Judo Championship in China.   In the finals they respectively beat their Chinese and Japanese rivals by Ippon.    Another Korean woman Judoist Ri Myong Hwa finished second in the 57 kg division.

articles.content:
Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed
   Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Committees for remembering the President Kim Il Sung were formed in Italy, Britain and Tajikistan on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his demise.   The chairman of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said at an inaugural meeting that Kim Il Sung founded the great Juche idea to indicate the road to be followed by humankind and wisely led the struggle for the building of an independent new world and performed undying feats for the era and history.   At an inaugural meeting of the British national committee for remembering comrade Kim Il Sung, participants said that the world progressives are significantly remembering his immortal feats.   The meetings decided to organize multifarious events to introduce and propagandize his exploits.

articles.title: "Noble Obligation Will Shine Long" off the press in China
Greetings to Laotian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
"Noble Obligation Will Shine Long" off the press in China
   Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- The Korean National Institute in China has recently brought out a book "Noble Obligation Will Shine Long" written by Zhang Jinquan, the son of Zhang Weihua who was a revolutionary martyr. 
   Printed in the book are photos showing the revolutionary activities of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   The author of the book cited detailed historical data on the warm solicitude and noble obligation shown by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for Zhang's families up to the 5th generation.

articles.title: U.S. and Japan lambasted for escalating tensions in Korea
articles.content:
Greetings to Laotian Foreign Minister 
    Pyongyang, June 28 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to his Laotian counterpart Somsavath Lengsavath, on the occasion of the 25th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations between the two countries.   The message said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have developed on good terms in different domains in the interests of the two peoples in the past 25 years.   Expressing the belief that these friendly and cooperative relations would continue consolidating and developing in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the Laotian Foreign Minister greater success in his responsible work.
